titleStmt.title: Ed Crossland et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9412

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency The Hon. Beriah Magoffin -- Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Marshall County Ky, would respectfully represent to your Excellency, that T. J. Strow is now confined in our county Jail for stabbing Nathaniel McManus; under a Judgment rendered against him, at the March Term 1860 of the Marshall Equity & Criminal Court, of Six months imprisonment, and a fine of Two hundred Dollars

Now in consideration of all the facts and Circumstances connected with the difficulty with McManus, we think it is a proper case for the interposition of the Executive Clemency And therefore pray that your Excellency to pardon said T. J. Strow as to said imprisonment, and remit said fine And as in duty bound we will ever pray &c
May 1860

Ed Crossland Comth Atty
J. C Gilbert
N B Roach
M M Mcginty
G. W. Irvin
H Johnston
A B Jones
J. T. Clark
J. H. Riley
